Post.title: Node.js:async/await
Post.author: Marshall
Post.content:
Async/await ES7 async/await HTTP DB Promise async/await

Node.js:await

try/catch

async function asyncFunc() {
    try {
        const token = await verifyToken(token);
        console.log(token)
    }
    catch(err) {
        console.log(err);
    }
}

try/catch async/await

to.js

1.CommonJSawait-to-js

$ npm i await-to-js --save
1.
const to = require('await-to-js').default;
2.
const[err,res]=await to(verifyToken(token))
if(err){
   console.log(err)
}else{
    console.log(res)
}

2.to.js

export default function to(promise) {
   return promise.then(data => {
      return [null, data];
   })
   .catch(err => [err]);
}
import to from './to.js'
const[err,res]=await to(verifyToken(token))
if(err){
   console.log(err)
}else{
    console.log(res)
}

Post.title: FrpJmeter Serverslave
Post.author: Marshall
Post._content:
binjmeter-serverserverFrprmi

## Slave  

### jmeter
`bin/jmeter.properties`  

```ini
remote_hosts=127.0.0.1
#
server_port=6789 
server.rmi.localport=6789 
```  

  
```bash
jmeter-server -Djava.rmi.server.hostname=0.0.0.0 #0.0.0.0frpsip
```

### frpc  
frpsfrpc  
rmi`tcp/ip`:
```ini
[jmeter]
type = tcp
local_ip = 127.0.0.1
local_port = 6789 # 
remote_port = 6789 #
```

## Master

### jmeter

`bin/jmeter.properties`  

```ini
[jmeter]
#0.0.0.0frpsipSlave
remote_hosts=0.0.0.0:6789
```

request

requestwx.requestPromise

//
import Config from './config'
import Token from './token'

function request (url, method, data, header = {}, noRefetch = false) {
  wx.showLoading({
    title: '' //  loading
  })
  return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    wx.request({
      url: Config.baseUrl + url,
      method: method,
      data: data,
      header: {
        'token': wx.getStorageSync('token'),
        'content-type': 'application/json'
      },
      success: function (res) {
        let code = res.statusCode.toString()
        let startChar = code.charAt(0)
        if (startChar === '2') {
          resolve(res.data)
        } else {
          if (code === '401') {
            if (!noRefetch) {
              Token.getTokenFromServer().then((token) => {
                //  token
                request(url, method, data, {}, true).then((res) => {
                  resolve(res)
                })
              })
            }
          } else {
            reject(res)
          }
        }
      },
      fail: function (error) {
        reject(error)
      },
      complete: function () {
        wx.hideLoading()
      }
    })
  })
}
function get (obj) {
  return request(obj.url, 'GET', obj.data)
}
function post (obj) {
  return request(obj.url, 'POST', obj.data)
}

export default {
  request,
  get,
  post
}

promisify

apipromise

/**
 * callbackapipromise
 *
 * 
 *     import {promisify} from '...' // 
 *     const res= await promisify(wx.showModal,{content:''})
 */
export function promisify( api, options, ...params ) {
  return new Promise( (resolve, reject) => {
    api( Object.assign( {},  options,  {
      success: resolve,
      fail: reject
    } ), ...params )
  } ).catch( err=>console.log(err) )
}

// 
export default {
  promisify
}

Post.title: mpvuevant-weapp
Post.author: Marshall
Post._content:
mpvuecsstailwind[Vant Weapp](https://vant-contrib.gitee.io/vant-weapp/#/home) 

## mpvueVant Weapp

### 1.
> static 

#### npm
``` bash
$ npm i @vant/weapp -S --production
```
 `node_modules/vant-weapp/dist` copy  `static/vant` 
#### git clone

```bash
$ git clone https://github.com/youzan/vant-weapp.git
```
 `dist`  `/static/vant/` 
### 2.
#### 2.1 
##### 
`src\app.json`
```json
"usingComponents": {
"van-button": "/static/vant/button/index",
}
```
###### 
 `main.json` 

#### 2.2  project.config.json
 `project.config.json`  npm 
```json
{
  ...
  "setting": {
    ...
    "packNpmManually": true,
    "packNpmRelationList": [
      {
        "packageJsonPath": "./package.json",
        "miniprogramNpmDistDir": "./miniprogram/"
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

#### 2.3 
.vue

### 
 api [Vant Weapp](https://vant-contrib.gitee.io/vant-weapp/#/home)
#### 
mpvue[mpvue](http://mpvue.com/)
##### 1.

###### 
```html
<button value="{{value}}"></button>
```
mpvue 
```html
<button v-bind:value="value"></button>
<button :value="value"></button> 
```
###### van-field 

```html
<van-field :value="registerform.username" label="" name="username" placeholder="" @input="registerform.username=$event.mp.detail"></van-field>
<button type="primary" @click="register"></button>
```
```js
export default{
    ...,
    data(){
        return{
            registerform:{
                username:'',
                ...
            }
            
        }
    },methods:{
        async register(){
            let{
                username,
                ...
            }={
                username:this.$data.registerform.username,
                ...
            }
                ...;
        }
        
    }
        
}
```

##### 2.

```vue
bind:click="onClick"
```
mpvue 
```vue
@click="onClick"
```

##### 3. event 
mpvueevent
```javascript
onChange(event) { // filed
  console.log(event.mp.detail) // mp
}
```

bind

Function.prototype.bind1 = function() {
    // 
    const args = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments) // 
    
    //  this
    const t = args.shift()
    
    // fn1.bind(...)  fn1
    const self = this
    
    // 
    return function() {
        return self.apply(t, args)
    }
}
function fn1(a, b, c){
    console.log('this', this)
    console.log(a, b, c)
    return 'this is fn1'
}
const fn2 = fn1.bind1({x: 100}, 10, 20, 30)
const res = fn2()
console.log(res)

new

function funcNew(obj, ...args) {
    const newObj = Object.create(obj.prototype);
    const result = obj.apply(newObj, args);
    return (typeof result === 'object' && result !== null) ? result : newObj;
}

instanceof

function newInstanceOf (leftValue, rightValue) {
    if (typeof leftValue !== 'object' || rightValue == null) { 
        return false;
    }
    
    let rightProto = rightValue.prototype;
    leftValue = leftValue.__proto__;
    
    while (true) {
        if (leftValue === null) return false;
        if (leftValue === rightProto) return true;
        leftValue = leftValue.__proto__;
    }
}

/*
 * ---  ---
 */

const a = [];
const b = {};

function Foo () {}

var c = new Foo()
function Child () {}
function Father() {}
Child.prototype = new Father()
var d = new Child()

console.log(newInstanceOf(a, Array)) // true
console.log(newInstanceOf(b, Object)) // true
console.log(newInstanceOf(b, Array)) // false
console.log(newInstanceOf(a, Object)) // true
console.log(newInstanceOf(c, Foo)) // true
console.log(newInstanceOf(d, Child)) // true
console.log(newInstanceOf(d, Father)) // true
console.log(newInstanceOf(123, Object)) // false 
console.log(123 instanceof Object) // false

function Animal(){ 
  this.type = "animal"
}
   
function Dog(){ 
  this.name = "dog"
}
 
Dog.prototype = new Animal()
 
var PavlovPet = new Dog(); 
 
console.log(PavlovPet.__proto__ === Dog.prototype) //true
console.log(Dog.prototype.__proto__ === Animal.prototype) //true

(Object)

MDN 

function deepClone(obj = {}) {
    if (typeof obj !== 'object' || obj == null) {
        // obj  null 
        return obj;
    }
    let res;
    if (obj instanceof Array) {
        res = [];
    } else {
        res = {};
    }

    for (let key in obj) {
        // 
        if (obj.hasOwnProperty(key)) {
            res[key] = deepClone(obj[key])
        }
    }
    return res;
}
// 
o = {a: 1, d: {c: '4'}};
res = deepClone(o);
console.log(res);
console.log(res == o);

const hero = {
  name: 'Batman',
  city: 'Gotham'
};
// ********************************************
const heroEnhancedClone = {
  ...hero,
  name: 'Batman Clone',
  realName: 'Bruce Wayne'
};

// 
heroEnhancedClone;  // { name: 'Batman Clone', city: 'Gotham', realName: 'Bruce Wayne' }

// ********************************************
const { ...heroClone } = hero;

// 
heroClone; // { name: 'Batman', city: 'Gotham' }
hero === heroClone; // => false

// ********************************************
const hero = {
  name: 'Batman',
  city: 'Gotham'
};

// 
const heroClone = Object.assign({}, hero);
heroClone; // { name: 'Batman', city: 'Gotham' }
hero === heroClone; // => false

const a = {};
const b = { key: "b" };
const c = { key: "c" };

a[b] = 123;
a[c] = 456;

console.log(a[b]);

// 456
//  key:
// a["Object object"] = 123;
// a["Object object"] = 456;

function debounce(func, wait) {
  let timer = null;

  return function () {
    if (timer) {
      clearTimeout(timer);
      timer = null;
    }

    let self = this;
    let args = arguments;

    timer = setTimeout(function () {
      func.apply(self, args);
      timer = null;
    }, wait);
  };
}

function throttle(func, wait) {
  let lastTime = 0;
  let timer = null;

  return function () {
    if (timer) {
      clearTimeout(timer);
      timer = null;
    }

    let self = this;
    let args = arguments;
    let nowTime = +new Date();

    const remainWaitTime = wait - (nowTime - lastTime);

    if (remainWaitTime <= 0) {
      lastTime = nowTime;
      func.apply(self, args);
    } else {
      timer = setTimeout(function () {
        lastTime = +new Date();
        func.apply(self, args);
        timer = null;
      }, remainWaitTime);
    }
  };
}

ajaxpost

function ajax_post(url, data) {
    // 1.  ajax
    var ajax = new XMLHttpRequest();
    
    // 2. url 
    ajax.open('post', url);
    
    // 3. 
    ajax.setRequestHeader('Content-type', 'text/plain');
    
    // 4. 
    if (data) {
        ajax.send(data);
    } else {
        ajax.send();
    }
    
    // 5. 
    ajax.onreadystatechange = function () {
        if (ajax.readyState === 4 && ajax.status === 200) {
            console.log(ajax.respenseText);
        }
    }
}

let pano={
    desc: 'example',
    minFov: 30,
    base: `./img/lowQualityImg/example_low.JPG`,
    position: {longitude: 0, latitude: 0, zoom: 50,},
    config: {
        width: 8192,
        cols: 32,
        rows: 16,
        tileUrl: (col, row) => {
            const num = row * 32 + col
            return `./img/example/tile_${('000' + num).slice(-4)}.jpg`;
        },
    },
}

api()

function loadPanorama(pano) {
    const loader = new THREE.ImageLoader();

    viewer.loader.show();

    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => loader.load(pano.base, resolve, undefined, reject))
        .then(image => {
            const canvas = document.createElement('canvas');
            canvas.width = image.width;
            canvas.height = image.height;

            const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
            ctx.drawImage(image, 0, 0);
            ctx.fillStyle = 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.3)';
            ctx.fillRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);

            return canvas.toDataURL('image/png');
        })
        .then(baseUrl => {
            return viewer.setPanorama({
                ...pano.config,
                baseUrl: baseUrl,
            }, pano.position);
        })
        .then(() => {
            viewer.navbar.setCaption(pano.desc);
            viewer.setOption('minFov', pano.minFov);
        });
}

var panos=[
        {

        minFov: 30,

            },
        },
    },

            },
        },
    }
]

function loadPanorama(pano) {
    const loader = new THREE.ImageLoader();

    viewer.loader.show();

    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => loader.load(pano.base, resolve, undefined, reject))
        .then(image => {
            const canvas = document.createElement('canvas');
            canvas.width = image.width;
            canvas.height = image.height;

            const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
            ctx.drawImage(image, 0, 0);
            ctx.fillStyle = 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.3)';
            ctx.fillRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);

            return canvas.toDataURL('image/png');
        })
        .then(baseUrl => {
            return viewer.setPanorama({
                ...pano.config,
                baseUrl: baseUrl,
            }, pano.position);
        })
        .then(() => {
            viewer.navbar.setCaption(pano.desc);
            viewer.setOption('minFov', pano.minFov);
        });
}

Vuex Electronindex.js

import Vue from "vue"
import Vuex from "vuex"

import { createPersistedState, createSharedMutations } from "vuex-electron"

Vue.use(Vuex)

export default new Vuex.Store({
  state: {
    count: 0
  },

  actions: {
    increment(store) {
      store.commit("increment")
    },
    decrement(store) {
      store.commit("decrement")
    }
  },

  mutations: {
    increment(state) {
      state.count++
    },
    decrement(state) {
      state.count--
    }
  },

  plugins: [createPersistedState(), createSharedMutations()],
  strict: process.env.NODE_ENV !== "production"
})

const {autoUpdater} = require('electron-updater')
async function createWindow() {
	const win = new BrowserWindow({
        ...,
        if (process.env.WEBPACK_DEV_SERVER_URL) {
        await win.loadURL(process.env.WEBPACK_DEV_SERVER_URL)
        if (!process.env.IS_TEST) win.webContents.openDevTools()
    }else{
        createProtocol('app')
        win.loadURL('app://./index.html')
        autoUpdater.checkForUpdates()
    }
    })
}
// ======================================================================
// 
// ======================================================================
if (!process.env.WEBPACK_DEV_SERVER_URL) {
  autoUpdater.autoDownload = false

  // autoUpdater.signals.updateDownloaded(() => {})
  autoUpdater.on('error', (error) => {
    log.warn(': ' + error == null ? 'unknown' : (error.stack || error).toString())
    dialog.showErrorBox('Error: ', error == null ? 'unknown' : (error.stack || error).toString())
  })

  autoUpdater.on('update-available', (info) => {
    // var appInfo = {
    //   info: info.version,
    //   files: info.files,
    //   path: info.path,
    //   sha512: info.sha512,
    //   releaseDate: info.releaseDate
    // }
    console.log(info)
    dialog.showMessageBox({
      type: 'info',
      title: '',
      message: '',
      buttons: ['', '']
    }).then((res) => {
      log.warn('index:' + res.response)
      if (res.response === 1) {
        log.warn('')
        autoUpdater.downloadUpdate()
      } else {
        log.warn(':')
      }
    })
  })

  // 
  autoUpdater.on('update-available', (res) => {
    log.warn('')
    log.warn(res)
    // dialog.showMessageBox({
    //   title: '',
    //   message: ''
    // })
  })

  // 
  autoUpdater.on('update-not-available', () => {
    log.warn('')
    // dialog.showMessageBox({
    //   title: '',
    //   message: ''
    // })
  })

  // 
  autoUpdater.on('update-downloaded', (res) => {
    log.warn(res)
    // console.log(res)
    log.warn('')
    dialog.showMessageBox({
      title: '',
      message: ''
    }, () => {
      log.warn('')
      setImmediate(() => autoUpdater.quitAndInstall(true, true))
    })
  })

  //
  autoUpdater.on('download-progress', (event) => {
    log.warn(event.percent)
  })
}

tsx

vite@vitejs/plugin-vue-jsx 

yarn add @vitejs/plugin-vue-jsx -D

vite.config.ts 

import { defineConfig } from "vite";
import vue from "@vitejs/plugin-vue";
import vueJsx from "@vitejs/plugin-vue-jsx";

export default defineConfig({
  plugins: [
    vue(),
    vueJsx(),
  ],
})

Select

OptionSelect + button > Optionpropsemit: 

<!--child.vue-->
<script lang="tsx">
import { Refresh } from '@element-plus/icons-vue'
import axios, { AxiosRequestConfig } from 'axios';
import { defineComponent, ref, reactive, onMounted } from "vue"
export default defineComponent({
    props: ['id'], // prop
    setup(props, { emit }) {
        let id = props.id
        interface optionsProps {
            label: string
            value: string
        }
        const options = reactive<optionsProps[]>([])
        //
        const getOptionsList = async () => {
            options.splice(0, options.length)
            const config: AxiosRequestConfig = {
                method: 'get',
                url: '/example',
                headers: {}
            };
            let data = await axios(config)
            let res = data.data
            res.map((item: string) => {
                if (item !== id) {
                    options.push({
                        label: item,
                        value: item
                    })
                }
            })
        }
        const selectValue = ref('')
        //Select
        const selectChange = (val: string) => {
            emit("getSelect", val)
        }
        onMounted(() => {
            getOptionsList()
        })
        return () => (
            <div class="container">
                //Vuetsx
                <el-select v-model={selectValue.value} onChange={selectChange}>
                    // v-for
                    {
                        options.map((item) => {
                            return <el-option
                                key={item.value}
                                label={item.label}
                                value={item.value}
                            />
                        })
                    }
                </el-select>
                <el-button icon={Refresh} size="large" onClick={getOptionsList} circle class="btn" />
            </div>
        )
    }
})
</script>

<style scoped>
.container {
    display: flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
}

.btn {
    margin-left: 10px;
}
</style>

MessageBox

})

                </el-select>
                <el-button icon={Refresh} size="large" onClick={getOptionsList} circle class="btn" />
            </div>
        )
    }
})
</script>
